Raw Material Extraction and Processing.description: Extraction and processing of raw materials like lithium for batteries, silica for glass, and metals like aluminum.
Raw Material Extraction and Processing.rationale: Raw materials are critical components, particularly metals and silica, which form the fundamental structure of the phone.

Component Production.description: Manufacturing of key components such as processors, camera modules, and display panels.
Component Production.rationale: Critical to the phone's performance and functionality, involving complex manufacturing processes.

Transport of Raw Materials.description: Logistics involved in moving raw materials and components from suppliers to Sony manufacturing plants.
Transport of Raw Materials.rationale: Transport impacts the carbon footprint and involves significant logistics management.

Assembly.description: Assembling components into the final product, including camera alignment and software installation.
Assembly.rationale: The core manufacturing process that transforms components into the finished device.

Quality Control.description: Ensuring the finished product meets performance and safety standards through rigorous testing.
Quality Control.rationale: Essential for maintaining high product standards and user safety.

Distribution.description: Transporting the finished products to various retail and online points of sale.
Distribution.rationale: Distribution logistics significantly impact energy usage and emissions.

Installation and Setup.description: User unpacking and initial setup of the phone, including software updates.
Installation and Setup.rationale: The process contributes to packaging waste and sets the baseline for user experience.

Product Use.description: Daily usage includes calling, browsing, and entertainment activities.
Product Use.rationale: Primary phase where user interaction determines the device's functional use.

Software Maintenance and Updates.description: Periodic software updates enhance performance and security.
Software Maintenance and Updates.rationale: Maintains device functionality and extends its usable life.

Screen Repair.description: Service for repairing or replacing broken screens.
Screen Repair.rationale: Common repair that saves resources by avoiding full device replacement.

Battery Replacement.description: Replacing the battery to extend device life when original battery performance degrades.
Battery Replacement.rationale: Critical for sustainability through device longevity.

N/A.rationale: Refurbishment not typically applicable to standard phone use.

Energy Use During Operation.description: Electricity used for charging and operating the phone.
Energy Use During Operation.rationale: Represents a significant part of the phone's life cycle energy consumption.

N/A.rationale: Water use is not applicable for electronic device use.

De-installation.description: Removing and preparing the device for recycling or disposal.
De-installation.rationale: Begins the end-of-life process necessary for proper recycling.

Transport to Recycling Center.description: Logistics involved in sending disposed devices to recycling facilities.
Transport to Recycling Center.rationale: Critical to ensuring devices are processed sustainably.

Recycling.description: The process of recovering materials from old devices.
Recycling.rationale: Reduces environmental impacts by reusing valuable materials.

Disposal of Non-Recyclable Waste.description: Managing waste that cannot be recycled, ensuring safe disposal.
